prompt: Two auditory segments are concatenated with 0.5 seconds of silence. Decide which segment has a higher pitch. Answer only 'A' (first) or 'B' (second). Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

Two sound clips are connected by 0.5 seconds of silence. Compare the perceived pitch of the two clips. Answer 'A' if the first is higher, 'B' if the second. Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

You will hear two sounds with a brief 0.5-second gap of silence. Determine which clip sounds more high-pitched. Answer only 'A' (first) or 'B' (second). Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

You are given a concatenated audio of two clips with 0.5 seconds of silence in between. Which clip has a higher tone? Only reply 'A' if the first, 'B' if the second. Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

A dual-segment audio is presented with 0.5 seconds of silence in between. Judge which segment has a higher fundamental frequency. Respond with 'A' for the first, 'B' for the second. Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

An audio contains two clips joined by 0.5 seconds of silence. Which clip has a higher musical note? Reply only 'A' or 'B' (A = first, B = second). Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.

The audio consists of two parts separated by 0.5 seconds of silence. Identify the clip with higher pitch. Use 'A' for the first, 'B' for the second. Do not add any explanation, punctuation, or extra text.
